newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine fugitive quits for "personal reasons".
newsitem.headline: Argentine fugitive quits for "personal reasons".

text.p: A top Argentine city legislator who has been on the run from justice for four days offered his resignation from an unknown hiding place on Tuesday, citing "personal reasons".

Jose Manuel Pico, a member of the governing Peronist Party and still formally president of the Buenos Aires city parliament, posted a note to his office saying he wanted to quit, parliament officials said.
Pico disappeared on Friday when a judge ordered his arrest for alleged corruption and fraud when he was in charge of a Buenos Aires municipal works department.
The Buenos Aires parliament will meet Wednesday to consider whether to accept Pico's resignation. Members of the centre-left Frepaso opposition alliance said they would refuse the request.

"We believe that as the resignation was presented while Pico is being sought by the police it cannot be accepted as it is illegitimate," Frepaso Buenos Aires parliamentarian Eduardo Jozami told the private DyN news agency.
